title: 107_s2860
content: The Act is titled the "Children's Health Improvement and Protection Act of 2002." It includes changes to rules for redistribution and extended availability of fiscal year 2000 and subsequent fiscal year allotments. Section 2104(g) of the Social Security Act is amended to include fiscal year 2000 and subsequent fiscal years in the redistribution rules. The redistribution rules under Section 2104(g) of the Social Security Act are amended to include fiscal year 2000 and subsequent years. State's expenditures under this title in fiscal years 2000, 2001, and 2002 exceed the allotted amounts for those years, as specified in subsection (b). The State's expenditures under this title in fiscal years 2000, 2001, and 2002 exceed the allotted amounts for those years, as specified in subsection (b). The available allotment under subsection (e) exceeds the State's allotment for that fiscal year under subsection (b). Changes are made to clauses regarding fiscal year allotments. Changes are made to fiscal year allotments, including extending availability of funds for expenditure by the State through the end of the fiscal year in which a redistribution is allotted. Changes are made to fiscal year allotments, extending availability of funds for expenditure by the State through the end of the fiscal year in which a redistribution is allotted, including specific provisions for fiscal years 2000 and 2001. The availability of funds for expenditure by the State is extended for fiscal year allotments, with specific provisions for fiscal years 2000 and 2001. Unused amounts allotted to a State for a fiscal year after 2001 can be carried over for expenditure until the end of the following fiscal year. For fiscal years 2000 and 2001, unused funds allotted to a State can be carried over for expenditure until the end of the following fiscal year, with specific provisions in place. For fiscal years 2000 and 2001, unused funds allotted to a State can be carried over for expenditure until the end of the following fiscal year, with specific provisions in place. The amount available for redistribution under subsection (f) for the fiscal year will be determined based on a formula involving the State's unexpended allotment and the total amount available for redistribution. For fiscal years 2000 and 2001, unused funds allotted to a State can be carried over for expenditure until the end of the following fiscal year. The Secretary will use the amount reported by the States on HCFA Form 64 or HCFA Form 21 for calculating allotments after 1999. Establishment of caseload stabilization pool and additional redistribution of allotments. Section 2104 of the Social Security Act is amended to include the redistribution of Caseload Stabilization Pool Amounts to eligible States with excess expenditures under the title. The redistribution of Caseload Stabilization Pool Amounts to eligible States with excess expenditures under the title is determined based on the State's allotment for the previous fiscal year compared to the total allotments made available to eligible States. The Secretary establishes a caseload stabilization pool for redistributing amounts to States with excess expenditures. Amounts redistributed remain available for expenditure through the fiscal year received. The pool includes unexpended amounts from previous fiscal years. The Secretary establishes a caseload stabilization pool for redistributing unexpended amounts to States with excess expenditures. SEC. 4. RESTORATION OF SCHIP FUNDING FOR FISCAL YEARS 2003 AND 2004. Amends the Social Security Act to increase funding for SCHIP for fiscal years 2003 and 2004. Additional funding is allotted to territories for these years as well.
